topicSummary: Deficiency of vitamin B12 or folate is the most common cause of megaloblastic anaemia.

topicHtmlObjects.htmlHeader: Anaemia - B12 and folate deficiency: Summary

latestChanges.title: Minor update
latestChanges.body: Maintenance dose schedule for hydroxocobalamin changed to every 2-3 months in line with the British National Formulary (BNF) BNF 76, 2018.

latestChanges.title: Reviewed
latestChanges.body: A literature search was conducted in March 2018 to identify evidence-based guidelines, UK policy, systematic reviews, and key randomized controlled trials published since the last revision of the topic.
